result.reason: mRemoteNG keyboard hooks likely consume or mishandle VK_RSHIFT (0xA1) differently from VK_LSHIFT, causing Chrome Remote Desktop to not receive right-shift events.
result.approach: Audit global keyboard hook handler for asymmetric left/right modifier key handling; ensure VK_RSHIFT passes through to child windows/processes the same as VK_LSHIFT.

attempts.raw_output:
Looking at this issue: Right shift key not recognized when using Chrome Remote Desktop alongside mRemoteNG. This is a keyboard hook/input handling conflict where mRemoteNG's global keyboard hooks may intercept or incorrectly handle the right shift key (VK_RSHIFT), preventing Chrome Remote Desktop from receiving it.

```json
{"decision":"implement","reason":"mRemoteNG keyboard hooks likely consume or mishandle VK_RSHIFT (0xA1) differently from VK_LSHIFT, causing Chrome Remote Desktop to not receive right-shift events.","priority":"P2-bug","estimated_files":["mRemoteNG/UI/Window/ConnectionWindow.cs","mRemoteNG/Tools/Keyboard/KeyboardHook.cs"],"approach":"Audit global keyboard hook handler for asymmetric left/right modifier key handling; ensure VK_RSHIFT passes through to child windows/processes the same as VK_LSHIFT."}
```
